summary: This bill, the Combating Houthi Threats and Aggression Act, focuses on addressing the threat posed by the Houthis in Yemen. It mandates reports to Congress on Houthi capabilities, attacks on shipping, and violations of the UN arms embargo.  The bill also imposes sanctions on individuals involved in attacks on international shipping in the Red Sea and Gulf of Aden, and those providing support to the Houthis. A sunset clause is included for five years.
